title: Viper setup script exited with error in ethereum setup command
body:
### What's your issue about?

I'm trying to build viper in a virtual environment using the viper documentation. I've gotten until "make", after cloning viper using git command. I get an output error:

**error: Setup script exited with error in ethereum setup command: 'tests_require' must be a string or list of strings containing valid project/version requirement specifiers; Unordered types are not allowed**

Here's the complete output, also containing the error at the end:

make: *** [init] Error 1

Is anyone familiar with this error and could help me out to resolve it?

#### Cute Animal Picture

![ljhivtx](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5228546/33516553-f5da6828-d774-11e7-91bd-5f8444225810.jpg)


Any help is appreciated, thanks in advance!

It looks like an issue with [pyethereum](https://github.com/ethereum/pyethereum). You should get on their gitter and ask what's up with it, and report back here!

Just quickly browsing, it looks like this is the problem:

```python
# setup.py:
...
setup_requires=[
        #    'pytest-runner==2.7'
],
...
```

Same issue...

Installed /root/viper-venv/lib/python3.6/site-packages/viper-0.0.2-py3.6.egg
Processing dependencies for viper==0.0.2
Searching for ethereum==2.1.0
Reading https://pypi.python.org/simple/ethereum/
Downloading https://pypi.python.org/packages/5c/0d/1ca85eb4ddcac8ef9612d7f635ebb37b7e651a86a4c03705c7b681d168b6/ethereum-2.1.0.tar.gz#md5=48421849d21063b7b17fe2933762aee6
Best match: ethereum 2.1.0
Processing ethereum-2.1.0.tar.gz
Writing /tmp/easy_install-jkj47wyw/ethereum-2.1.0/setup.cfg
Running ethereum-2.1.0/setup.py -q bdist_egg --dist-dir /tmp/easy_install-jkj47wyw/ethereum-2.1.0/egg-dist-tmp-r58bpu_t
error: Setup script exited with error in ethereum setup command: 'tests_require' must be a string or list of strings containing valid project/version requirement specifiers; Unordered types are not allowed
Makefile:4: recipe for target 'init' failed
make: *** [init] Error 1

Thanks for the advice! I looked a bit into pyethereum but decided to try a fresh install of my macbook. After installing High Sierra I followed the viper installation instructions and everything works fine now. No idea what the problem really was, but a fresh install fixed it. Yippeee!
I think you would probably find that the version of `pyethereum` was recently updated to 2.1.5, which fixed the problem you were encountering with their setup
